HelpInfo:
FooBar
The worker box allows you to change what type of jobs your worker will work on! The 4 roles are general, crafter, gardener, and synthesizer.
You can move around the world using WASD. You can zoom in and out using the Z/X keys. When building use left click to place and right click to destroy. You can also open the inventory using the E key.
Congrats on starting your first space station! Check the goals box to see your first task. Good Luck!
Nothing can pass through walls.
Space rock appears randomly throughout the world. One can obtain it by using the mine space rock tool (in the actions box). Once you have it, you can use the workbench to turn it into steel to build walls, metal floors, etc.
The workbench allows you to craft more complex things. To craft, use the manufacture box. Once you click craft, a worker will begin to work on that task. Note: The workbench only works on craftable things. Dirt/Unobtainium require other machines.
Compressors add oxygen to your space station. Note: The room the compressor is in must be enclosed (with walls and floors) or else the oxygen will vent into space.
Saplings need three things to grow: oxygen, dirt, and space. Saplings require a 3x3 area (centered on the sapling) to grow.
Dead plants form when plants (saplings, potatoes, etc.) fail to survive in their environment. To grow, plants need oxygen (at least 15%) and dirt floors.
Dust collectors collect dust from the surrounding gasses. It requires 2 PU / T. To produce power, you can build solar panels and you can transfer it via conduits.
Solar panels produce a constant rate of 1 PU / T. Power can be transferred using power conduits.
Gather steel so that you can start your base. You can collect steel by mining space rock. To mine rock, use the mining tool in the actions box. Once you have space rock, you can use the workbench, to craft steel. \n Reward: 8 Dirt
Gather copper so that you can build more advanced blocks. Similar to steel, you can collect steel by mining space rock and using the workbench \n Reward: 8 Dirt
Grow potatoes so that your worker can eat. In order for potatoes to grow, they need to be on a dirt floor and they must have oxygen to breath. The oxygen level can be raised by using an air compressor. Note: If the room has any gaps in the walls or floors, the oxygen will escape! \n Reward: 8 Dirt compost
Using the composter, you can compost leaves to create dirt. Place down a composter, and use the manufacture menu to select how much dirt to make. A gardener will then place dirt in the composter, wait for it to compost, and then pick it up.
Now that you have space dust, you can use the synthesizer to create unobtainium. Because synthesizing takes so long, it will take your workers multiple sessions to synthesize one piece.
Space dust is an important substance that can be used to synthesize more complex substances. It can be collected by dust collectors, which require power to run. Power can be generated using solar panels. \n Reward: 1 Unobtainium
Power ingots are used for fuel in the arc reactor. Power ingots are created in a similar method to unobtainium. Using the synthesizer, workers can convert space dust into new elements!
Arc Reactors are the most powerful generators ever built. They use power ingots, a rare and complex material, to generate immense amounts of power (50 times more energy than a solar panel).
To collect wood, you can grow trees, and then use the cut tree tool in the actions box. Trees need a 3x3 area (centered on the sapling) and oxygen to grow.
Woodroot is a powerful plant that grows out of parasites within wood. The plant takes a long time to grow, but provides a lot of food when harvested. Note: Woodroot requires one piece of woodroot to start growing the plant! \n Warning: Your workers will choose to eat woodroot over potatoes so you must plant it before they eat it.
